alert.note: Alert for Laurens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 6:34PM EDT until June 25 at 12:31PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Laurens. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance to Minor flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, greenways,low-water crossings, underpasses, urbanized areas, and low-lying roadways and parking lots. High flows over low-water crossings and low-lying roadways are possible and water may approach low-lying structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 634 PM EDT, Numerous thunderstorms are developing and training over Laurens County and are quickly producing significant rainfall. Up to 2 inches of rain has fallen over the past 60-90 minutes. Minor flooding is imminent. If this heavy rain persists, a Flash Flood Warning may be issued. Caution is advised near any stream or other vulnerable area, including flood-prone areas in the city of Laurens, including along the Little River and Little River Park. If you live near a stream or creek be prepared to seek higher ground when the water begins to rise. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Laurens, Clinton, Fountain Inn, Woodruff, Gray Court, Cross Hill, Waterloo, Lake Greenwood, Greenwood State Park, Coronaca, Mountville, Ora, Hickory Tavern and Enoree.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
